hits.event_name: Berkeley, CA City Council Regular Meeting
hits.content:
[PAGE 1]
CITY OF BERKELEY CITY COUNCIL
REGULAR MEETING
January 14, 2026

CALL TO ORDER
Mayor called the meeting to order at 6:31 p.m.

ROLL CALL
Councilmembers present: Kesarwani, Wengraf, Robinson, Bartlett, Harrison, Taplin, Hahn, Droste.

APPROVAL OF AGENDA
Approved without changes.

[PAGE 2]
AGENDA ITEM 1
BUDGET AMENDMENT
Staff presented a midyear adjustment to align departmental expenditures with revised revenue estimates.
Public comment focused on funding priorities for housing services and traffic safety improvements.
Action: Motion to approve budget amendment.
Vote: All Ayes.

AGENDA ITEM 2
PUBLIC SAFETY UPDATE
Informational report received and filed.

ADJOURNMENT
Meeting adjourned at 10:08 p.m.
hits.summary: The council opened the meeting, reviewed a budget amendment, and approved it unanimously.

hits.event_name: Cupertino, CA Environmental Review Committee Meeting
hits.content:
[PAGE 1]
CITY OF CUPERTINO ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW COMMITTEE
REGULAR MEETING
January 21, 2026

CALL TO ORDER
Meeting convened at 5:00 p.m.

ROLL CALL
Committee members present: Chair Morales, Member Singh, Member Park.

[PAGE 2]
ITEM 1: TREE CANOPY IMPACT REVIEW
Staff summarized environmental impact findings for proposed corridor improvements.
Committee discussed mitigation options, replacement ratios, and monitoring cadence.
Action: Recommend approval with added annual reporting requirement.
Vote: 3-0.

ITEM 2: STORMWATER COMPLIANCE STATUS
Report accepted; no action required.

PUBLIC COMMENT
Two speakers requested stronger construction-phase protections.

ADJOURNMENT

[PAGE 1]
CITY OF CUPERTINO AUDIT COMMITTEE
SPECIAL MEETING
January 25, 2026

CALL TO ORDER

ITEM 1: FISCAL UPDATE
Finance staff reviewed quarterly revenue performance and expenditure controls.
Committee requested additional variance detail for capital projects over $1M.

[PAGE 2]
ACTION
Motion to accept fiscal update and forward recommendations to City Council.
Vote: Motion carried.

ITEM 2: INTERNAL CONTROL WORKPLAN
Discussion on procurement controls and grant documentation readiness.

ADJOURNMENT
hits.summary: Prior summary generated from older extracted text.

hits.event_name: Berkeley, CA Planning Commission Regular Meeting
hits.content:
[PAGE 1]
CITY OF BERKELEY PLANNING COMMISSION
REGULAR MEETING
January 30, 2026

CALL TO ORDER
The meeting was called to order at 7:02 p.m.

ROLL CALL
Commissioners present: Alvarez, Chen, Lopez, Patel, Rivera, Singh, Walsh.

APPROVAL OF MINUTES
Minutes from January 16, 2026 were approved.

[PAGE 2]
PUBLIC COMMENT
Speakers addressed housing affordability, transit access, and neighborhood design.

CONSENT CALENDAR
Item A: Design review extension for 2100 University Avenue.
Item B: Administrative zoning correction for mixed-use parcel map.

[PAGE 3]
AGENDA ITEM 2
ZONING MAP AMENDMENT
Staff report presented options for rezoning from C-SA to C-NS to align with adopted housing policy.
Action: Motion to approve amendment with findings.
Vote: 6-1 approved.

NEXT MEETING
February 13, 2026
hits.summary: The commission approved a zoning map amendment after public comment.

hits.event_name: Cupertino, CA City Council Regular Meeting
hits.content:
[PAGE 1]
CITY OF CUPERTINO CITY COUNCIL
REGULAR MEETING
February 3, 2026

CALL TO ORDER
Mayor called the meeting to order at 6:45 p.m.

PLEDGE OF ALLEGIANCE

ROLL CALL
Councilmembers present: Moore, Tanaka, Shah, Rivera, Delgado.

[PAGE 2]
AGENDA ITEM 1
HOUSING ELEMENT UPDATE
Planning staff provided status on state review comments and implementation milestones.
Public comments focused on tenant protections and displacement mitigation.
Action: Continue item to next regular meeting for revised draft language.

AGENDA ITEM 2
BUDGET ADJUSTMENT FOR PERMIT PROCESSING
Action: Approved budget transfer for temporary staffing support.
Vote: 5-0.

ADJOURNMENT
Meeting adjourned at 10:14 p.m.
hits.summary: Council reviewed the housing element update and continued the item.

hits.event_name: Berkeley, CA Transportation Commission Special Meeting
hits.content:
[PAGE 1]
CITY OF BERKELEY TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION
SPECIAL MEETING
February 10, 2026

CALL TO ORDER

ITEM 1: BIKE NETWORK EXPANSION
Staff reviewed protected lane options and phased implementation schedule.
Commission discussion highlighted safety at major intersections and school routes.

ITEM 2: TRANSIT SIGNAL PRIORITY
Presentation on corridor-level transit delay reduction.
No formal vote taken.

PUBLIC COMMENT
Residents requested better curb management and bus stop accessibility.

ADJOURNMENT

[PAGE 1]
CITY OF CUPERTINO FINANCE COMMITTEE
REGULAR MEETING
February 12, 2026

CALL TO ORDER
Meeting called to order at 4:02 p.m.

MIDYEAR BUDGET REVIEW
Revenue performance is tracking 2.3% above forecast.
Expenditure categories with variance were public works and facilities maintenance.

[PAGE 2]
CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM STATUS
Project updates: library modernization, stormwater upgrades, park lighting replacement.

ACTION
Motion to recommend amended appropriations to City Council.
Vote: Approved unanimously.

NEXT STEPS
Staff to prepare final recommendation memo.
hits.summary: Committee approved the midyear budget review recommendations.

hits.event_name: Berkeley, CA City Council Closed Session
hits.content:
[PAGE 1]
CITY OF BERKELEY CITY COUNCIL
CLOSED SESSION
February 14, 2026

CONFERENCE WITH LEGAL COUNSEL
Existing litigation and anticipated litigation matters were discussed.

PUBLIC EMPLOYEE PERFORMANCE EVALUATION
Limited to positions authorized under applicable law.

REPORTABLE ACTION
No reportable action from closed session.

ADJOURNMENT
hits.summary: Closed session convened to discuss legal matters. No reportable action.

hits.event_name: Cupertino, CA Parks and Recreation Commission Meeting
hits.content:
[PAGE 1]
CITY OF CUPERTINO PARKS AND RECREATION COMMISSION
REGULAR MEETING
February 18, 2026

CALL TO ORDER

ITEM 1: CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PLAN PRIORITIES
Commission reviewed project ranking criteria: safety, equity, lifecycle cost, and neighborhood access.

ITEM 2: COMMUNITY EVENT CALENDAR
Discussion on summer programming and volunteer capacity.

PUBLIC COMMENT
Residents requested expanded evening programming at neighborhood parks.

ADJOURNMENT
hits.summary: Commission discussed park capital priorities for FY 2026-27.

hits.event_name: Berkeley, CA Housing Advisory Commission Regular Meeting
hits.content:
[PAGE 1]
CITY OF BERKELEY HOUSING ADVISORY COMMISSION
REGULAR MEETING
February 20, 2026

CALL TO ORDER

TENANT PROTECTION PROGRAM UPDATE
Staff reported year-to-date outcomes for legal assistance and relocation support.
Members requested disaggregated data by neighborhood and income level.

[PAGE 2]
RENT STABILIZATION OUTREACH
Community partners described multilingual outreach progress and landlord training sessions.

ACTION
Commission directed staff to return with implementation options and funding impacts.

ADJOURNMENT
hits.summary: The commission reviewed tenant protection outcomes and directed staff follow-up.
